title: Introduction to Kinematics
content_html:
Introduction to Kinematics

Kinematics is the branch of physics that describes the motion of objects without considering the forces that cause the motion.

Key Concepts

  • Displacement: The change in position of an object
  • Velocity: The rate of change of displacement
  • Acceleration: The rate of change of velocity

Equations of Motion

For uniformly accelerated motion:

  • v = u + at
  • s = ut + ½at²
  • v² = u² + 2as

Where:
v = final velocity
u = initial velocity
a = acceleration
t = time
s = displacement

mcqs.question: What is the displacement of an object that moves from position x₁ = 5m to x₂ = 12m?
A car accelerates from rest at 2 m/s² for 5 seconds. What is its final velocity?
mcqs.explanation: Using v = u + at: v = 0 + (2 m/s²)(5s) = 10 m/s
